com.soa.message.handler.wsdl

Interface WSDLHandlerContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, HandlerContext

    public interface WSDLHandlerContext
extends HandlerContext
    HandlerContext extension for creating handlers based on static WSDL content.
    Since:
    6.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.xml.namespace.QName getInterfaceName()
      Returns the name of the interface the operation specified in the getOperationName() method is defined in.
      java.lang.String getMessageName()
      Returns the name of the message the handler should specifically handle.
      java.lang.String getOperationName()
      Returns the name of the operation the handler should specifically handle.
      ParameterType getParameterType()
      Returns the parameter type (IN, OUT, FAULT) the handler should specifically handle.
      java.lang.String getPortName()
      Returns the name of the port the handler should specifically handle.
      java.lang.String getServiceKey()
      Returns the unique key of the service the handler should specifically handle.
      javax.xml.namespace.QName getServiceName()
      Returns the name of the service the handler should specifically handle.
      javax.wsdl.Definition getWSDLDefinition()
      Returns a WSDL document for additional context.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.soa.message.handler.HandlerContext

        clone, getProperty, getPropertyNames, setProperty

    • Method Detail

      • getServiceName

        javax.xml.namespace.QName getServiceName()
        Returns the name of the service the handler should specifically handle. This is an optional property. If no service is identified, the handler may receive messages for any service.
        Returns:
        QName of the service, null if not limited to an individual service.

      • getServiceKey

        java.lang.String getServiceKey()
        Returns the unique key of the service the handler should specifically handle. This is an optional property. If no service is identified, the handler may receive messages for any service.
        Returns:
        Unique key of the service, null if not limited to an individual service.

      • getPortName

        java.lang.String getPortName()
        Returns the name of the port the handler should specifically handle. This is an optional property. If no port is identified, the handler may receive messages for any port.
        Returns:
        Name of the port, null if not limited to an individual port.

      • getOperationName

        java.lang.String getOperationName()
        Returns the name of the operation the handler should specifically handle. This is an optional property. If no operation is identified, the handler may receive messages for any operation.
        Returns:
        Name of the operation, null if not limited to an individual operation.

      • getInterfaceName

        javax.xml.namespace.QName getInterfaceName()
        Returns the name of the interface the operation specified in the getOperationName() method is defined in. This is an optional property and is only provided if an operation name is provided.
        Returns:
        Name of the interface (Port Type) for the operation, null if no operation is specified.

      • getParameterType

        ParameterType getParameterType()
        Returns the parameter type (IN, OUT, FAULT) the handler should specifically handle. This is an optional property. If no operation is identified, the handler may receive messages of any type for the operation.
        Returns:
        ParameterType identifying the parameter, null if not limited to an individual type.

      • getMessageName

        java.lang.String getMessageName()
        Returns the name of the message the handler should specifically handle. This is an optional property. If the parameter type is IN or OUT, then no message name is required. If the parameter type is FAULT, then a message name is required if there are more than one fault defined for the given operation.
        Returns:
        Name of the message, null if not required.

      • getWSDLDefinition

        javax.wsdl.Definition getWSDLDefinition()
        Returns a WSDL document for additional context.
        Returns:
        WSDL Definition.
